title: What is the difference between technology consultant and business consultant? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good question and a difference that many companies fail to comprehend. From our practice, business consultants work in the software world along with technology consultants - you can extrapolate how different business consultants might function in other areas of focus. The technology or software technology consultant is going to come in and help set up software (or hardware as needed). For example, a software technology consultant will help implement the Inventory Module, creating inventory items, defining the attributes of those items, setting the reorder points, tracking actual sales of each item, linking the PO’s to the Receiving Dock scans so we measure real lead times - all the technical setups, configuration, training and everything to make the users adequate at using the software. He’ll know how to tie items to cost codes, sales and the underlying GL accounts. The business consultant is going to come in and say ‘why do we have so much inventory in the warehouse’ and find out the owner blows his stack when a sale is lost due to stockouts of one or another item, so the purchasing agent has bought double of everything needed. The business consultant compiles the cost of capital needed to maintain this $20m in inventory, suggests it would be cheaper to purchase software to manage this issue, and helps users rank and track inventory items to discover that there’s only 15 of the 15,000 items that ever really ‘stockout’ - so we don’t need $20m in inventory, really only $3m, with emphasis on those 15 items and an accurate demand forecast that shows we really only run out seasonally, during Easter break and back to school periods. So the business consultant comes up with the ‘why’ we need some software solution to address an issue, the technology consultant has the ‘how’ we deploy the software. The technology consultant makes sure the software works, the business consultant makes sure the company is using the software to make the business work. Many ERP companies talk about ROI and how companies using their software profit. However, that’s not due to the software, it’s due to how managers use the software. Every ERP implementation is a technical project and a business management project Companies that do the technical project well spend a lot of money. Companies that do the business management project well make a lot of money.

To give you a sense, a similar question is what is the difference between Opthalmologist and Cardiologist? They both are doctors but look at different functional parts of the body. Similarly, a technology consultant will consult you on decisions related to technology selection, application and execution across the life cycle of that decision making process. A business consultant on the other hand will consult on decisions that affect the business of a company - They could be decisions on marketing, pricing, operations, finances etc There could be some overlap between the business and technology consultant but broadly that is the difference among the two.

Consultants solve the most intractable problems of a range of industries and companies.Here are some difference lies between business and technology consultant: Technology consulting involves finding out how technology can improve a business Whereas business consulting covers the functioning of an organization. Technical consultants mostly specialists by education (engineers, doctors, lawyers etc. with years of advanced professional education and experience. Business consultants are typically more people oriented than technical consultants, and often apply soft science psychology or market research and emotional appeals to achieve results. Consulting in general is the service of offering advice to a client that Helps them reach a stated goal faster. A technology consultant is someone who is an expert in using technology to reach a goal. An example would be a someone selling software with training on how to use the software to reach a goal. Another example would be SEO. An SEO consultant uses technology to help his client improve google rankings. A busines consultant can use technology but usually is not an expert on technology. A business consultant helps clients create marketing plans, improve sales, 3x or 10x sales or reach any stated goal. Focus and scope are different. Business consultants often focuses on economy / shareholder value, efficiency… (new markets, product development, financials, marketing, sales, pricing, strategy, logistics, procurement, operations, and so on). Examples are A.T.Kearney, Arthur D. Little, L.E.K., Simon Kucher & Partners, … Bain, BCG, McK Technology consultants focusses more on e.g. IT, architecture, infrastructures, data center, storage, facilities, and so on. Examples are TÜV Group, DEKRA, Fichtner, Altran, IBM, DXC, … But there are often „bridges“ and also „Full Service Provider“ like Accenture, Capgemini, Atos, NTT, TATA,…
